verses.verse: Then Zophar, <S%H6691><s%> the Naamathite, <S%H5284><s%> answered, <S%H6030><s%>
"Shouldn't <S%H7230><s%> the multitude of words <S%H1697><s%> be answered? <S%H6030><s%> Should a man <S%H376><s%> full of talk <S%H8193><s%> be justified? <S%H6663><s%>
Should your boastings <S%H907><s%> make <S%H2790><s%> men <S%H4962><s%> hold their peace? <S%H2790><s%> When you mock, <S%H3932><s%> shall no man make you ashamed? <S%H3637><s%>
For you say, <S%H559><s%> <S%H3948><s%> 'My doctrine is pure. <S%H2134><s%> I am clean <S%H1249><s%> in your eyes. <S%H5869><s%>'
But <S%H199><s%> oh that <S%H5414><s%> God <S%H433><s%> would speak, <S%H1696><s%> and open <S%H6605><s%> his lips against you, <S%H8193><s%>

that he would show <S%H5046><s%> you the secrets <S%H8587><s%> of wisdom! <S%H2451><s%> For true wisdom <S%H2451><s%> has two <S%H3718><s%> sides. <S%H8454><s%> Know <S%H3045><s%> therefore that God <S%H433><s%> exacts of you less than your iniquity deserves. <S%H5771><s%>
"Can you fathom <S%H2714><s%> the mystery <S%H4672><s%> of God? <S%H433><s%> Or can you probe <S%H4672><s%> the limits <S%H8503><s%> of the Almighty? <S%H7706><s%>
They are high <S%H1363><s%> as heaven. <S%H8064><s%> What can you do? <S%H6466><s%> They are deeper <S%H6013><s%> than Sheol. <S%H7585><s%> What can you know? <S%H3045><s%>
Its measure <S%H4055><s%> is longer <S%H752><s%> than the earth, <S%H776><s%> and broader <S%H7342><s%> than the sea. <S%H3220><s%>
If he passes by, <S%H2498><s%> or confines, <S%H5462><s%> or convenes <S%H6950><s%> a court, <S%H7725><s%> then who can oppose him?
For he knows <S%H3045><s%> false <S%H7723><s%> men. <S%H4962><s%> He sees <S%H7200><s%> iniquity <S%H205><s%> also, <S%H995><s%> even though he doesn't consider it.
An empty-headed <S%H5014><s%> man <S%H376><s%> becomes wise <S%H3823><s%> when a man <S%H120><s%> is born <S%H3205><s%> as a wild donkey <S%H6501><s%>'s colt. <S%H5895><s%>
"If you set <S%H3559><s%> your heart <S%H3820><s%> aright, <S%H6566><s%> stretch out your hands toward him. <S%H3709><s%>
If iniquity <S%H205><s%> is in your hand, <S%H3027><s%> put it far away. <S%H7368><s%> Don't <S%H5766><s%> let unrighteousness dwell <S%H7931><s%> in your tents. <S%H168><s%>
Surely then you shall lift up <S%H5375><s%> your face <S%H6440><s%> without spot; <S%H3971><s%> Yes, <S%H3332><s%> you shall be steadfast, and shall not fear: <S%H3372><s%>
for you shall forget <S%H7911><s%> your misery. <S%H5999><s%> You shall remember <S%H2142><s%> it as waters <S%H4325><s%> that are passed away. <S%H5674><s%>
Life <S%H2465><s%> shall be clearer <S%H6965><s%> than the noonday. <S%H6672><s%> Though there is darkness, <S%H5774><s%> it shall be as the morning. <S%H1242><s%>
You shall be secure, <S%H982><s%> because there is <S%H3426><s%> hope. <S%H8615><s%> Yes, <S%H2658><s%> you shall search, and shall take your rest <S%H7901><s%> in safety. <S%H983><s%>
Also you shall lie down, <S%H7257><s%> and none shall make you afraid. <S%H2729><s%> Yes, <S%H7227><s%> many shall court <S%H2470><s%> your favor. <S%H6440><s%>

But the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> shall fail. <S%H3615><s%> They shall have no way to flee. <S%H6><s%> Their hope <S%H8615><s%> shall be the giving up <S%H4646><s%> of the spirit. <S%H5315><s%>"
